alert.note: Alert for Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mingo County through 615 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Williamson, or over Williamson, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 25 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Delbarton, South Williamson, Red Jacket, Chattaroy, Aflex, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Matewan, Myrtle, Hampden, Pie, Naugatuck, Dingess, Varney, Meador and Lenore. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
